alert.note: Alert for Bergen; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:03PM EST until December 20 at 5:48AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York...New Jersey... Ramapo River near Mahwah affecting Passaic, Rockland, Orange and Bergen Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Mahwah...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River near Mahwah. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, State Route 202 floods downstream. Moderate flooding along Route 202 and Route 17. Water into backyards. Minor flooding along Brakeshoe Place, Brook Street and Catherine Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM EST Tuesday was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 5.8 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.6 feet on 06/23/1972. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Ramapo River Mahwah 8.0 8.6 Tue 5 pm EST 6.7 6.1 MSG &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM EST.
